According to EPC Article 122, re-establishment of rights can only be sought if an applicant fails to observe a time limit due to circumstances beyond their control, but missing the filing deadline within the priority period is usually deemed non-compliance with procedural requirements and cannot be remedied by requesting re-establishment of rights.

Instead, this fee is related to the remedy process once the application has been deemed withdrawn or non-compliant due to procedural issues. Therefore, missing such a fee cannot be remedied by requesting re-establishment of rights for another unrelated procedural issue.
